messages.message:
Hi Team, re:
https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C05L87V014J/p1742927088008699
The default image apparently disables stats.  I am unable to check how many messages are in a queue, etc currently.
```Stats in management UI are disabled on this node```
Can we make this change to the crafting template to enable stats. https://stackoverflow.com/questions/63708061/how-to-enable-stats-in-rabbitmq-management-ui
Hmm, I can’t see an option in the UI nor in their docs to change that config. Let me open a thread with the Crafting devs

Okay, according to the devs, it’s not supported with the way we’re doing it atm:
https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C03B865Q74K/p1742936813781089

They recommend spinning up your own rabbitmq container with the correct config. Perhaps you can run this container on your laptop and port forward it to the sandbox? Here’s a doc using redis but rabbitmq should be the same:
https://instabase.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/TI/pages/2292711449/Connect+Crafting+to+Local+Services
I ended up using amqp python example script. It shows number of messages but doesn’t show args.
